meanings.definition: To offer a higher price than someone else in order to buy something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to outbid the other buyers for the rare painting.
meanings.sent2: During the auction, he managed to outbid everyone for the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The determined collector was ready to outbid anyone for the valuable stamp.
meanings.sent4: In the intense bidding war, she outbid her competitors with a final offer.
meanings.sent5: He was willing to outbid anyone to add the limited edition book to his collection.

meanings.sent1: The enthusiastic bidder was determined to outbid his opponents at the auction.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outbid everyone at the charity auction.
meanings.sent3: The competitive siblings playfully tried to outbid each other for the toy car.
meanings.sent4: In the final round, he strategically outbid his rival to win the game.
meanings.sent5: The clever negotiator knew how to outbid his competitors without overpaying.
